title: Is Kai a common name in Ionia...
body:
...or is Irelia's brother part of Varus right now?

I just noticed the names Irelia says while going for a long distance

> Father, mother, Zelos, O-ma, Ohn, Kai, little Ruu... 

And realized I already saw that name somewhere. Together with Valmar, Kai is currently "in" Varus right now. He also mentioned he is Navori in the comics. Is it just coincidence?

replies.body: I forgot the red post but it was stated along time ago that Kai is the **John** of Ionia, means, its a common name there.

“ai” is a common vowel used in a lot of words and names (taken from old words).

Shuriman favors short words and then combines multible words to create new meanings —sometimes only vaguely related to the root word.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EFUOWgr8,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-06-21T16:37:14.005+0000)
>
> “ai” is a common vowel used in a lot of words and names (taken from old words).
> 
> Shuriman favors short words and then combines multible words to create new meanings —sometimes only vaguely related to the root word.

{{champion:163}} (at her diary) Taliyah ai Nasaaj.  Taliyah ai Zaun.  Taliyah ai Nasaaj-Zaun.  Taliyah ai Zaun-Nassaj.  Decisions, decisions...

{{champion:268}} (writing orders) Theorderisgiven.  Theorderisgiven.  Theorderisgiven.

{{champion:101}} (brooding) IwilldestroyAzir.  IwilldestroyAzir.  IwilldestroyAzir

{{champion:58}} (trudging) Nasusbetrayedme.  Xerathisperfect.  Eateverybody.

{{champion:75}} (asleep) Stacksstackstacksstacksstacks. Stacksstackstacksstacksstacks.  Stacksstackstacksstacksstacks.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EFUOWgr8,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-06-21T16:37:14.005+0000)“ai” is a common vowel used in a lot of words and names [taken from old words].

So, this begs a question from me.

Kai'sa. Clearly a name of Shuriman origin, and seems to indicate that Kai is not a gender-specific name. Is the Kai'sa styling to indicate the use of the name on a female, a relic of Shuriman naming that's extremely uncommon (as no other Shuriman character has it), or a specific thing used for giving names to Void creatures? If the latter, what does "Sa" add to it's meaning, given that Kai seems to be such a common name? Is it the Shuriman Void equivalent of "Jane Doe?"
Her original name used to be Kaisa.  But after being bonded to a voidling, the people of shurima now see her as a voidspawn.  Not Kaisa, but Kai'Sa.
The apostrophe is the mark of the void.

>Shuriman favors short words and then combines multible words to create new meanings

Sounds like more elegant Germans.

Sadly, Irelia's brother's name is "Kye" which is an alternate way to spell the common Ionian name "Kai", the two are not the same person. 

Trust me, I would've loved some connections, it could've had a lot of potential if left open. 

Source: https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/8b1ulz/were_the_rioters_who_updated_irelia_ask_us/dx3c4y0/?st=jioh6qd7&sh=c8fbcd1a
Oooh, too bad. Thanks for the clarification.
Which enforces even more the argument of Val and Kai just being representation tools rather than actual characters.

****And the plot thickens****

Nice catch, by the way. I didn't even notice she said Kai until now.

It might be the same character.
I mean Irelia would likely think that Kai died in that attack.
